1.content:
It's an ordinary day in Area 11. The city is calm, and the people are peaceful. You're walking down the side of the street.

"Out of the road!" roars a voice from behind you. In an instant, three Knightmare Frames accelerate past, causing a huge draft that causes litter and papers to fly everywhere. But despite that, you hear a faint voice nearby.

You look around, and can just barely see a lock of green hair coming out from behind a set a trash cans. You push the cans aside, and find a girl in a loose white jumpsuit lying motionless on the ground. You take her in your arms, and check her pulse. You don't feel anything...

Despite that, the girls eyes shoot open, and she leans up, kissing you on the lips. You phase out, and hear the girl's voice as she pries into your mind. You hear something about "Geass" and a contract, and mindlessly answer "Yes."

You're back to reality. The girl is lying motionless in your arms. You set her on the ground so you can catch your breath, and catch up on what just happened. First off, who are you?
1.title: Codename: Geass

11.content:
You sure picked a great day to cut class. Before you have a chance to catch your breath after your spontaneous lip-lock, the three knightmare frames from before roll up before you, with their guns fixated on you.

"There she is."

"We've found her! Get her, quick!"

"Give her here, boy!"
11.title: A Britannian Student

111.content:
You pick up the girl, and carry her over to a Knightmare, where one of the soldiers comes out to take her. "Ha, stupid boy. He doesn't realize just what kind of power this girl has."

"What was that?" you ask. Did he say power?

The soldier looks at you with a confused look, and insists that he didn't say a word. You don't recall ever seeing his lips move either. ... Could it be? Did that kiss give you the power to read minds? It must have! It all adds up, now that you think about it.

You have obtained Geass. You can read minds!

What about the girl?

112.content:
"I won't let you take this girl!" You announce boldly. You hear the sound of laughter from inside the Knightmares, before the three pilots come out, and approach you. You step back, placing yourself between the girl and the soldiers.

"Alright, looks like we're going to have to do this the hard way." One of the soldiers points his gun at you, making eye contact. You stare back, and wish you had some way to stop him.

Suddenly, you feel a mental rush, and you blast forward at the soldier. A moment later, you're wearing a thick military uniform, and pointing a gun at a boy who looks exactly like you. "Huh?" you let out.

"Something wrong, Captain?" one of the soldiers asks you. You look side to side, and then at your body, which is staring blankly, with a small symbol displayed in the eyes. Somehow, you've transfered your mind into this soldiers body! You've possessed him. Is that the Geass you heard during your kiss with the girl?

Quick, use this to save your skin!
112.title: Mind Transfer

1122.content:
You turn on the men at your sides, and wildly fire your gun at them until they're dead on the ground. After that, you turn the gun on yourself, intending to kill off the soldier, but you stop because you don't know what would happen if he died while you were still in his body.

A moment later, a police Knightmare shows up, and grabs you, who just murdered two people. You're dragged away. Just before being shoved into the brig of the Knightmare, you feel yourself being shot back to your body, just in time to see the soldier carried away.

"That worked well." You say, as you regain consciousness. With that, you turn and pick up the mysterious girl whom with you shared a kiss, and carry her home with you.

11221121211.content:
As the comm device goes dead the enormity of what you have gotten yourself into has finally hit you. You, a high school student, a Brittainia no less, betrayed your own country. Sure you had always thought it wrong that your country had come in and annexed japan and made its people second class citizens. Sure you even felt sympathy for the elevens who were being slaughtered right in front of your eyes because the military thought they were all terrorists. But to actually join them was another thing all together. Also there was the matter of this new strange power you had, Geass as C.C. called it. You still have no idea what to make of it. But one thing was clear there was no turning back. Suddenly the Sutherland jerks to a stop and you realize you're in an abandoned warehouse. You realize this must be a base of operations for the Black Knights; especially seeing other Knightmare frames and techies swarming over them. The cockpit opens and you come back to yourself. C.C wordlessly guides you out, and you enter what might have been an office in another time, though the lights were off and you couldn't see to the far end of it.
"Welcome to our base of operations. You should assume since we brought you here that you have very few options, and none of those include headed back to your life as a Brittainian citizen as you may well have guessed." Zero states from the darkness. You can tell that the threat behind those words is very real, and you consider how to proceed very carefully.
11221121211.title: You meet  Zero

112211212111.content:
You realize that the only way you were getting out of here was either by joining Zero's cause (whether or not Zero even considered that an option, you have no idea) or in a body bag. But you also realize that someone as important Zero wouldn't talk to a high schooler off the street if there wasn't something more than just seeing the base going on. Then you remember Geass.
"So I assume you know about this Geass power? Presumably more than I do in any case?" You ask Zero, trying to maintain your composure.
Zero waits for a moment before answering. "So you really did make a contract with him then C.C?" Behind you C.C simply nods.
"Well then I suppose there's no harm in telling you. Yes I know of Geass." His willingness to tell you as much confirmed your suspicions that he does not consider you a threat.
"Which brings me to the point. What is your Geass power?" Zero asks in his all business manner.
Trying to keep yourself composed you answer "I can possess other peoples bodies."
"Interesting..." Zero states and you can practically hear the gears turning inside his head.
"I suppose I can't just leave here then can I?" You ask with a bit of dry humor.
"You would be correct. You have two choices. You may join the black knights. Or... Well I assume you understand the situation. No one else can know of Geass."
"Well...I see... Before I make the obvious choice though I have one question."
"You may ask, but don't expect an answer." Zero states.
"What is your Geass?"
"Ah. That I cannot answer just yet."
You...

You feel a hard slap to your face as you start to regain consciousness. You open your eyes to see a familiar face. You take a minute to recognize it as Kallen, the sickly girl from your high school who almost never attended.
"What kind of man throws up when he just sees a couple Knightmares get sho... Wait Edward is that you?"
"Umm yeah... Kallen, right?" You say and she nods. Remembering what Zero said about your name you then add: "Oh and if you please don't call me by name you can call me... Reen... yeah that'll do."
"Umm, yeah sure whatever. How'd someone like you end up here anyway?"

"I never figured you to be such a coward."
"Yeah well I never figured you to be... so... Not sickly." You mentally facepalm at your feeble attempt to dodge the subject.
"Yeah... anyway, I assume since you were let in here and you're not tied up that you joined the Black Knights." Kallen says, accepting your subject dodger for what it is.
"Your assumption would be correct."
"I suppose it's not that surprising. I always did hear you were into military stuff, but I thought you would join the Britainian military before the Black Knights."
"Yeah funny how that goes, I thought I would too, my father was a commando after all."
"Was?"
"He died in area 2 near the Gulf of Guinea a couple years ago, the Britanian government never released the cause of death. He did teach me basic hand to hand and a little bit on how to pilot a Knightmare."
"Oh sorry for bringing it up."
"No problem. By the way how'd Zero know to send you guys to flank."
"Well he said that a new guy brought in a Sutherland that probably had a tracking unit on it. You can guess the rest from there. I suppose you're the new guy."
"Guess so."
"In any case we're clearing out of this area and moving to a new location. You better check in with Zero."

1122112121111121121.content:
You find Zero talking to a rather plain looking man, and from what you catch from the conversation his name is Oigi and they're discussing logistics on how to move their supplies to the nearest base. Seeing you approach Zero wraps up the conversation and motions you to follow him to his office. In the office he turns around to you, and you could swear he gives you an angry glare, even though his face is covered by his helmet.
"What were you thinking? Never use Geass in public unless you absolutely have to." Zero fumes at you.
"I didn't think we had any choice." You say lowering your gaze from Zero and Zero quickly adopts his businesslike tone once more.
"Nothing to be done about it I suppose. From your reaction I'd have to guess that you experienced that pompous commanders death?"
You remain silent. After a few moments Zero continues.
"I suppose I should take that as a yes then. Interesting... Well in any case have you decided on a new name for yourself among the Black Knights?"
"Reen."
"Odd name, what does it mean?"
"Nothing"
"In what language?"
"No I mean I made it up when Kallen found out who I was."
"You know Kallen?" Zero says slightly surprised
"Yeah she goes to my school. Always thought she was sickly, sort of surprising to see her here."
Zero pauses for a moment and takes off his helmet again.
"Then you must go to the same school I do. This should prove conveinent." Suddenly as you see Zero's true face you realize where you've seen it before.
"You're Lelouche Lamprouge, you're on the student council right?" Lelouche nods.
"Speaking of, I have some matters to settle back at home, which gives you the perfect opportunity to try out being Zero." Lelouche produces a second helmet and cape from a desk in the back and hands them to you.
"So the Great Zero moonlights as a high school student huh?" You say dryly as you put on the helmet.
"There is a voice module in this helmet so you will sound like Zero when you speak. Mind you I've already settled the logistics of the base move so your presence will be more ornamental than anything, C.C. will guide you through it" As he speaks Lelouche presses a few buttons on a wall panel and a secret passage opens up.
"This is a trial run, know that if you mess this up in any way I already have provisions to see you removed." And you can tell that he's absolutely serious. Lelouche disappears down the passage as it closes seamlessly leaving you wondering what you're supposed to do next. Suddenly someone enters the office. It's...

113.content:
Clean hands are your top priority in this situation, all that matters is escaping with not even the slightest blemish to your name, but cooperation and obstinacy both lead to the same end: a day of questioning with the Britannia soldiers. The only way to be rid of such an obstacle is to make an escape, but the Knightmares make for two spectacular reasons why this won't work right away. The only option available is to get them out of their machines, thus applying a wide berth and allowing one sharp turn to free you from their sights. While certainly top of the line war machines, the older models these three were piloting lacked some of the peacetime features of modern patrol Knightmares, such as the ability to sense an object smaller than a compact car (thus why they almost turned you into street pizza).

Hiding your reservations and ulterior motives, you calmly and slowly raise your hands to shoulder level and dawn your best smile, one that can shine a brilliant white light through even Knightmare monitors, all while racking your brain for the right words and lies. Fortunately, the years of practice allow these to come with relative ease.

"Soldiers!" you call. "I'm all too happy to oblige my government and its military, but I'm also a bit of a skeptic. While I'd love to aid in any business concerning the empire, I'd prefer to know I'm actually performing an act for the sake of the country and eradicate my doubts, and it would be so helpful if the large rifles weren't being pointed at me."

"Yeah right!" a voice calls from the right-most Knightmare. The gruff voice and crude accent left little doubt in your mind this was either an Eleven from the ghettos or a Britannia who couldn't afford to live in the affluent parts of Area 11. "You just want us to hand over a reward."

"I'm not even securing the girl, and prior to your outburst I had no clue you even wanted this girl alive, and that may be only a preference. I want nothing for myself, I just wish to know I'm doing the right thing. Please, redirect your weapon so we can talk about this like adults."

"You son of a..." the poor one calls again, evidently offended by something you said. However, this time the one in the middle moves its left arm upwards, defending you from both a rifle assault and another charge.

"All right," a gentle soprano calls from the middle frame. "I don't see the harm in discussing what we can. Lower your weapons, boys."

"But Cindy!"

"No butts, Eleven. Lower your weapon or deal with mine."

The two on the side do as "Cindy" commands, allowing you to rest easier now that you're not staring down their barrels. However, one concern about the Knightmares' design continues nagging at you, clearly plastering your worries over your face and wiping off the smile.

"Thank you very much, but there's one final problem. Since the one on my right seems to have a number of grievances with me, I feel it would be best if his hands weren't on the Knightmare's controls. Forgive me if this is out of line, but perhaps you could exit the frames and allow us to communicate face to face?"

"He's jerking us around!" This time it's the one on the left getting hot under the collar, and you're not too surprised. "All he wants to do is laugh at us and show him we're desperate!"

"Even so," your savior replies, "it's best for Britannia to foster a good relationship with the masses, and the first step to that is through the military's generosity and compassion. History has shown that torture and open hostility have only been useful for making enemies and grinding progress to a halt. He'll be more cooperative if we don't make him an enemy, and we can even ask her to restrain the girl first."

The cockpit of the middle frame opens wide, allowing a beautiful young Britannian to stand upright. Her golden locks cascaded down her shoulders and disappeared below her waist, the angle and frame of the Knightmare preventing you from establishing the length of Rapunzel's hair, but what you saw framed her heart shaped face perfectly and contrasted wonderfully against the slight tan. Her pink lips formed a welcoming smile, and the innocent glint in her brown eyes suggested she hasn't once pulled the trigger in a real combat situation. With the two frames bending to her will and the blue uniform hugging her curvy body tightly, it was almost as if the scene before you was a photoshoot for a print ad endorsing enlistment, and you knew it would win over just about every heart - men off their erotic fantasies and women off their dream of being dominant.

"My subordinates won't emerge until we know we're not losing the girl, so here." While calling out to you, Cindy was reaching into the pockets of her uniform and pulled out something that clanked with each movement she made. It wasn't until she threw did you realize they were two items, two sets of handcuffs. You already had a pretty good idea what she wanted, but she still continued, "Cuff her hands behind her back and her feet together, then they'll step out of their Knightmares."

With a sigh, you kneel down and begin the task assigned to you. While this would only serve to complicate things once you made a retreat and force you to carry her if it became necessary to take her with you, it at least promised you a chance at getting away. The most you could hope for at this point is that you don't need to help this person and that the dragging of your fingers is distorting your fingerprints beyond recognition if you give them the one smelling of pizza. And you certainly didn't want to learn this was some entrapment tactic or a variant of the Milgram experiment.

At least I got what I wanted, you think to yourself while witnessing the two pilots of the flanking frames exit concurrently. The three soldiers road down from their cockpits, happy to oblige but weary all the same. The young Eleven Cindy identified wore a scowl across his face, and made sure to clearly express the sour taste you left in his mouth, and for reasons beyond your politeness - your clothes and the affluence they radiated were almost certainly more fuel for the impoverished Eleven's fiery hatred. On the other hand, his partner, an older Eleven certainly on the verge of retirement from the service, showed less contempt for you and more towards her Britannian handler, almost as though he couldn't believe she's falling for this show of airs.

Much to your dismay, their cooperation didn't come as much as you had hoped and expected. They may have left their the cockpits and stepped on the pavement, but they're not even a centimeter from the elevator that reunites them with the controls, and those are in a terrific state of operation at present. Worse yet, they brought out their assault rifles with them. They're still lowered at the ground, but that's not inspiring much confidence. Turning the corner and escaping is certainly possible, though extremely risky and heavily reliant upon them hesitating of having poor aim, or would be if you didn't have the girl chained up like a common criminal. Her restraints would force her to take baby steps and allow her to be followed more easily than a tornado, and the time it would take you to pick her up and run would eat up all of your time to escape. Leaving her is certainly an option and would give you that time, but you're not in the mood for such a high stakes gamble. The only thing you can do is try to charm them into taking a few big steps away from the machines, or play to their animosity and make them turn on each other like starved and stranded explorers. Either way, you take a breath and focus.

"Now then," you begin, "what has caused you three to come looking for this girl?"

You couldn't explain it, but suddenly something felt different, like the air had gotten thinner or everything was merely an image on a computer monitor. Nothing felt real anymore.

In response to your question, Cindy speaks out, "The girl's wanted on suspicion of terrorist activity."

However, that wasn't the only thing you heard, and the scene before you became more surreal. As Cindy was talking, it seemed almost like she had a second set of lips, a much lighter shade of pink, saying something completely different. It was almost like the dubbing of a movie from the Chinese Federation, but even those still had only one set of lips. Adding to the strangeness was something like a faint echo of her voice saying "The little whore claimed to want some real lovers like us and not some pompous child like you."

Between the prior exchanges with Cindy and the images that border on hallucinations, the bizarre and classless words were enough to make you stagger and arch your eyebrows. You wanted to be enraged at the words and make Cindy suffer for even thinking them, but on the other hand you knew something was wrong and that they were armed Britannian soldiers. You simply had to maintain...

"Like he even knows what to do with a girl!" The voice came from the older Eleven on Cindy's right. Much like before, the scene was trippy to the eyes and a faint echo called out, "There's no need for name-calling, Lieutenant Perry!" However, this time it seemed different, the echo was softer and the second lips were less apparent, almost as though it was coming into focus.

"He may sound like a baby, but he's certainly not one otherwise." Cindy's verbal lashing seemed totally in focus this time, nothing seemed even remotely unusual about the scene to your senses. However, it still made no sense to your mind, it was getting harder to think when these scathing insults, juvenile as they may be, made it impossible to focus your thoughts and approach this predicament armed with only your words at the ready.

"YOU ASSHOLES!" was the last coherent sentence you heard. What followed were grunts and groans mixed in with a hail of gunfire.
113.title: A baiting turned bizarre.

choices: "I work with Britannia's enemy." (Universe with Lelouch/Zero option)
"I can grant The Power of Kings." (Universe without Lelouhc/Zero option)
1131.content:
Almost instinctively, you rushed down to the pavement and out of the line of fire. Having witnessed the gun rising, you were able to duck down just in time to avoid any stray bullets from the young Eleven's rifle. On the other hand, the blind-sided blonde wasn't so lucky. Without any armor over her uniform, the flesh of her back consumed no less than a dozen bullets and spat out at least a liter of blood in several powerful gushes. Serving as more than enough proof of the weapon's power was the body, which quickly went from being almost a meter away to right on top of you and painting you the same color as the pavement Cindy traversed.

Terrified, you didn't dare move the cold frame of the soldier off of you to get a better look. Luckily what you heard was more than enough for you to piece it together yourself.

"Drop the weapon, put your hands in the air, Takashi!" You recognized this voice as the older Eleven.

"AS IF!" And that was the younger one, Takashi. Once again, this was just before his gun burst into life aiming to take the older one's as compensation.

This time, Takashi wasn't alone in his attack.

It was hard to hear, but you could faintly make out a quicker succession to the bullets this time, indicating the older one also pulled his trigger to stop Takashi. However, it was hard to be sure; the screaming booms of the guns didn't sound for nearly as long as the first stream that took Cindy. You tell yourself, "Either the older one killed Takashi, or..."

Mustering up some courage, you move Cindy's legs apart just enough to see past them and take a look. Takashi had made his way to the brick wall his Knightmare almost knocked down when he entered the alley and was steadily collapsing. At the same time, the older one was hunched over, clutching his stomach with his left hand, hoping to dam the rushing of blood rushing out to the cliff's edge. He attempted to make his way back to his Knightmare's cockpit, undoubtedly to signal for help, but his staggering legs barely carried him back to his position prior to his duel with Takashi before he too fell under gravity's merciless influence.

"What just happened?" you ask aloud. It wasn't to anyone in particular, you just needed to center yourself, and quickly.

"Your Geass," a voice answers.

You were bathed in sunlight once more once Cindy's body was picked off of you and haphazardly tossed aside. Above you was the green haired girl you...kissed? Was that real, or another of today's bizarre incidents? Regardless, the set of keys she dropped next two you answered how she was ambulatory after being restrained, and the new occupant of her hands answered why she needed to drop those keys. Without missing a beat, the rifle from your former meat shield was turned against the expiring Eleven with the shortest stream yet.

"WHAT THE HELL WAS THAT FOR!?"

"He was a threat to me. Do I need any other reason?"

"Preferably! He was already a dead man walking! ...So to speak."

"I don't like such useless gambles when I have a safe certainty at arm's length."

You wanted to continue, but already figured out this was going to be like talking to a brick wall. Instead, you shrug it off and redirect the conversation onto a topic she started.

"All right," you begin, "the Eleven was a threat to you even as he died. Now, what was that thing you said, a 'Geass' was it?"

"Yes, The Power of Kings. A power that makes you above all other humans."

"Nice little speech, but it's no good. I don't remember having any power, and I certainly don't remembering activating any power."

The girl giggles at your flustered speech and face, apparently mocking you ignorance. "It seems your desires led you to activate it subconsciously."

I'll indulge her, you muse, believing it'll lead you to some truth anyway. "Okay, so what is my Geass? How did it make these soldiers turn against themselves?"

"Geass manifests itself in different ways for different people. For some reason, it became The Ability of False Perception in your case. Now you can make people see, hear, smell, taste, and feel what isn't actually there."

"That...actually makes a bit of sense." It fits your experience at the very least. If your Geass activated, then the voices in pairs were both what was actually being said and what it became after your Geass altered it, and the second set of lips you noticed were the Geass making their lips move in tune with the new words. "But why did it keep changing? It seemed like reality was more dominant at first, but then the illusion took control."

"You lost your focus. Once you stopped protecting yourself, the Geass affected you as well."

"It fits."

Admittedly, you did lose your focus after you stopped talking; you weren't focusing on making them do something, you were focused on what she was saying. Hearing the distasteful speech from Cindy removed most of your focus, allowing the fake words from the older Eleven to take more control, and when they dropped what was left Cindy's true intentions didn't have even one thread to follow.

"But if I stopped concentrating, why did the illusion continue?"

"Your Geass is a spirited one. It doesn't stop until it completes the goal you instilled within it when it activates."

More logical answers, you think to yourself. In this case, your last focus was to stir up animosity, hoping this would distract them enough for you to flee, but it seems the Geass didn't get that last part and just made them attack each other. In any case, it worked, you got them to attack each other in ways you can only imagine...meaning she is the only one who managed to make use of your distraction. How does the Geass...

You think, I'm actually buying this! The girl may have made one amazingly convincing story, but that's just it: a story! No such power exists outside of fantasy stories and mythology. Next she's going to try saying another Geass allows someone to move the sun along the sky as if it was pulled by a chariot. No matter how logical, the unreal can never even hope to be the truth.

"That answers that," you lie, putting up a front as you carefully close the gap between you and the strange lunatic. "Now, let's talk about something more interesting."

"Such as?" she asks.

"YOU!"

With swift movements, you're able to parry the gun to her left, forcing it and her right arm across her body. Now that her arms were immobile, a swift kick to her knee was all that was necessary to snake your way between them and locking them where they can't force you off of her. And the pain radiating across her face was a nice bonus, a compensation for what she's put you through.

"Now then," you continue as though nothing happened, "why were those soldiers after you?"

"Didn't you hear Cindy's answer?"

"I did, and it looked like she was being honest. But her superiors could have lied to her. I want to hear it from you. And try to tell the truth, or I go back on the assault."

"You can't kill me, I'm immortal."

"I don't believe you, but even if you are, you already showed me you can feel pain. I'll ask one last time: Why did those three soldiers come looking for you?"

"Fine," she sighs. "They were looking for me because...
1131.title: Continued.

choices: The knightmare gets fired on from afar...
114.content:
You slowly begin to back up, looking desperately for a chance to escape.

"Don't move!" the solider shouted, his voice being amplified through the knightmare's speakers. It was looking bad for you, even if you broke out into a run, there was no way you would be able to outrun the soldiers. The knightmare in the middle began to move forward to retrieve the girl.

"Now just hand her over and..."

At that moment a rocket zip past, striking the knightmare in the head with a large explosion following its wake.

"We are being attacked, return fire!" one of the remaining knightmares shouted to the other, its gun firing out in direction the the rocket came from.

Seeing your opportunity to escape, you prepared to break out into a run, but before that you picked up the unconscious girl and hauled her with you: you couldn't just leave her behind. Pushing your legs to go as fast as possible, you ran away as the sounds of gunfire broke out around you.

You didn't get as far away as you wanted before your breathing started to become labored and your legs becoming tried. You had never been an athletic type and carrying another person tired you out quickly. Seeing a bridge you trudged your way under and set the girl down before resting against the wall. You had no idea what those soldiers wanted with the girl but at least you have managed to escape them for...

A crash sounded to your left bringing with a shake as an knightmare landed next to you.

"Found you!" the knightmare's speakers blasted as its gun pointed towards you. "You have put me through so much trouble, but now it is time for you to die!"
114.title: Run For It!

choices: Take the stairs and investigate the noises...
Take thee street and go away from the noises...
1141.content:
It was over, you knew it. In a few seconds you will just be blood splatters against the concrete wall behind you. Knowing of your soon demise, you close your eyes and defensively held out your arms, as if it would somehow help against the bullets and would soon end your fate. Squeezing your eyelids tight, you heard the sound as the gun fired a burst of rounds at you, and then... nothing.

Taking a risk, you open your eyes and to your surprise you see several oversize bullets floating inches away from you. The soldier in the knightmare seemed just as surprised as you as he had not moved since, instead just starting at the miraculous sight. Taking a dare, you moved your hands towards the giant, floating bullets, trying to touch one. Before your hand reached the object though, all the bullets shot out, racing towards the huge knightmare in front of you. In an instant, the knightmare was taken down as a sudden hail of bullets blasted away at it. You stood there in shock as the purplish knightmare fell down to the ground in a large crash. What had just happen? Did you just take down that knightmare by yourself? Why did they want that girl? Questions raced through your mind as you tried to figure out what exactly had happened.

Suddenly your thoughts were distracted as sounds of gunfire echoed from above you. Shaking your head to clear your thoughts, you picked up the still unconscious girl and turned around. It wasn't safe to stay where you were, you needed to get out of there as quickly as possible. Looking ahead, you saw two possible paths you could take. You could either head up the stairs, to the top of the bridge you are under and find out what is making all the noise, or you could go straight ahead and head away from the noises of battle.
1141.title: Awakening

11411.content:
Deciding that it would be best to check out what was causing the noises from above, you headed up the stairs, your arms carrying the girl with you. As you reached the top of the stairs, you see that the bridge consist of two railroad tracks running side by side over the city.

Looking down the track, you see a red knightmare, strangely missing one arm, riding down the tracks with two more purplish knightmares, similar to the ones you saw earlier, following closely behind, as if they were chasing the red one. The purplish knightmares were quickly catching up to the one in front, and just when it seemed like they would reach it, a train came barreling down the track, hitting and slowing down the two knightmares as the red one quickly leaped over the train. The train didn't stop the two knightmares for long, as one of the purple knightmares attempted to leap on the train.

Suddenly, before the purple knightmare reached the ground, two slash harkens fire out from a nearby building and hit the knightmare, destroying it completely. You couldn't see exactly what was in that building from your position, but the purple knightmare seemed to face whoever fired out the harkens only to receive a hail of bullets which crippled the knightmare's leg. Before the knightmare had a chance to counterattack, however; the crimson colored knightmare charged out, forcing the knightmare to fire out what looked like a rocket.... no, an ejection pod, which flew out in to the air for a while until air chutes popped out and the pod softly floated to the ground.

Turning back to the red knightmare, you saw that a couple of people came to meet the reddish knightmare. Although it was hard to make out from your position, it looked to be a fairly large group of elevens and they seemed to be carrying... guns.

The whole scene suddenly made sense now: the people in front of you are terrorist, elevens who oppose Britannia's rule over Japan. Watching the terrorist from your hiding place at the stairs, you see them talking to someone over the radio, though you are too far away to listen to what they are saying. Walking over to the sides of the train, one of the rebels open the container door and, to your amazement, reveals a vast collection of Knightmares stored in the train. You had no idea where the elevens had managed to obtain such a large collection Knightmares but a chance has just opened up for you.

You had no idea wether or not you have seen the last of Britannian soldiers that are looking for you, but if you could sneak in try to steal one of the knightmares then you use it to escape, but there was always a chance that you would get caught and the rebels would not treat a Britannian like you too nicely. Your second options could be to attempt to follow behind, and use the chaos of what looks to be an open up attack on the Britannian army by the rebels. Either way sounded risky, but it seemed much better then trying to get out on your own.
11411.title: A Chase and a Chance

12.content:
Wait, could this girl be related to the recent terrorist attacks somehow? You decide to question her to find out more. You poke your rifle into her rib, until she opens her eyes and stares up at you. "Ah, so you're the one..." she says, before closing her eyes and passing out again.

You pick her up, and bring her back to your Sutherland. The higher ups might want to know more about this. As you strap her into the back of the cockpit, you hear the voice of your friend, Hermond, calling out to you. "What did you find? Looks interesting!" he says.

"I found a strange girl on the side of the road. I'm going to bring her back to base for questioning," you reply without turning around.

"That's..." Hermond gasps in shock. You hear his gun being cocked. "Mine. I'm the one who's going to be taking that girl. "
12.title: A Britannian Soldier

121.content:
"Calm down, buddy. Just take her."

Hermond climbs into your cockpit, and unstraps the girl, bringing him back to his own Knightmare. Before leaving, he approaches you. "Yeah, I'm going to make it big with the powers I get from this girl. Unfortunately, I can't risk having you around to rat me out." He holds his gun to your head, and pulls the trigger.

You panic, and imagine yourself knocking the gun from his hand. To your surprise, the gun is mysteriously knocked from his hand, exactly as you had imagined it, except, you didn't raise a finger.

"Wait, Are you telling my... You... You Bastard!!"

You must have gained the power of telekinesis, the ability to move objects with your mind!
121.title: Telekinesis

choices: Steal the Knightmare with the girl in it.
Runaway before more soliders come here.
1211.content:
You use your new powers to make the gun float towards your hand at a fast speed and wrap your hand on the handle,
place your finger on the trigger, and immediatly, without any second thoughts, point the gun at him.

He raises his hands in quick panic and cries, "W-w-wait! There's no to reason to act rationally here! Just let me go; I'll won't
speak of this anyone, so long as live!'

"Well here's my answer." You press your finger on the trigger and feel the recoil vibrate in hand to your forearm. You watch
the soliders' visor shatter, with shards of glass and small trickles of blood flying from the impact. He collapsed on the ground,
making a loud thud due to his armor bashing on the rocky, bare ground.

You glare at his lifeless body, the blood from the gunshot impact filled his helmet, leaking from the cracks of his visor.
You can't believe that you killed a ranking officer of the army you were part of. You committed friendly fire; you could
be executed for such an act. There's only three things you can do...
1211.title: Take the girl back

You start getting into your Knightmare, in order to fight for her. From his reaction you know that she is worth something. You catch his eye at the last second, before getting into your Knightmare, and suddenly Hermond starts screaming about being blind.
He is your best friend, so you decide to talk with him. But he is deaf as well, apperently. This is the perfect time to leave you decide. Hermond starts to scream with a different tone, one without words. One that lasts only a second, but you can make out the tone. The tone of pain. The JLF Knightmares surround you and take the girl.
"Join us or die." They say, because thay are losing the war.

you shrugged, why should he worry he like this new power he then hears a call to return to base, according to this he has to meet... Lady Cornelia!
