An EU ambassador, on your way to a summit.
15.content: Here are some more choices...
15.title: Decisions...

choices: Hai uses the Geass for her own benefit
CC teaches her how to use the Geas
151.content:
Hai Luo was interrupted by C.C. Hai was cross because she was late for an important date with the Eleven District, so the Chinese lady brushed her aside.
"Wait," interrupted CC, "What if I told you I had the power to mind-control (Geass) people through a contract?" Hai was reconsidering her options and a wide smile spread across her face, "Tell me more," Hai suggestively stated, brushing aside her hair as she readjusted her scarlet uniform.
"Well, you know the Elevens and the fight for the Sakurdite?" CC embellished,
"I am quite aware of these affairs in the district" Hai Luo stared to CC's disbelief.
"Okay, you seem like a good option for a candidate," CC stated calmly, "Now hold still" Suddenly there was a sensation of a hot poker and Hai blinked.
"Did it work?" Hai asked?
"It should work now" CC confirmed.
151.title: Hai Luo, a Chinese correspondent

choices: Pick up one of the guns and kill the soldiers.
Make them think you're dead and flee.
152.content:
You never would have imagined that such an ordinary day would end up like this. As an official ambassador for the Euro Universe, your job was to make your way to the Viceroy's palace to negotiate with Prince Clovis over the ongoing North African conflict, in the hopes that you could end the fighting and spare your people. That goal seems so distant now, though, as you pick up the unconscious girl and try to find help for her. The streets around you seem to be slowly erupting into violence, as soldiers and Knightmare Frames scramble about, picking off anyone who gets in their way.

You stick to the shadows, hoping to avoid the chaos by staying out of sight. Soon enough, however, you find yourself headed off in an alley by a squad of Britannian soldiers. Frightened for your life, you flash your badge and invoke your diplomatic immunity, pleading in halting English for them not to shoot. The soldiers are not fazed; they level their guns at you, saying, "Consider it void, you filthy Hun! You've seen far too much!"

You cringe in terror, prepared for the end, but before they open fire, the world seems to grind to a halt. The same voice that you heard in your head when the green-haired girl kissed you rings in your mind once more. "You have the power to stop this," she says. "When we made our contract, I granted you a great power. I suggest you use it."

Snapping back to reality, you instinctively put your arms down and stare directly toward the soldiers. You feel a tingle in your eyes as this "power" activates, permeating the soldiers' very minds. Suddenly, they drop their weapons and scream. "What in God's name... Aagh, a snake! Kill it, kill it!" 'What happened?' you think to yourself. Somehow, you've convinced them that their guns have turned into snakes! 'This must be the power she mentioned...'

Now armed with the ability to induce hallucinations, you ponder your next move...
152.title: "It's just been revoked!"

choices: Use your Geass to fight your way out.
Forget this!  You need to leave the country, fast!
1521.content:
*For the sake of keeping the reader character nondescript, I decided to mask it with sound effects, like the show did with C.C.'s name, to render it indistinct.

Without thinking, you desperately grab one of the soldiers' assault rifles and fire indiscriminately. The panicking soldiers drop dead; they never knew what hit them. You stand over the bodies, stunned at what you've just done, and before you can think of anything else, the girl suddenly speaks. "Nice job, [distant sirens]*. I have to say, that was rather clever for a first time Geass-user." Strangely, her German is impeccable, though her actual origin is impossible to tell.

"Huh?" you ask. "How do you know my name? And who are you? And what is this 'Geass' thing?" "Slow down! I'm getting to that," said the green-haired girl. "I've been watching you for quite some time, [truck drives by]. You may call me 'C.C.' And what I've given you is Geass, the Power of the King. In return, I expect you to do something for me."

"What might that be?" Flashing a brief, playful smile, she answers. "Oh, it's not important... for now, at any rate. What matters right now is what you plan to do. I don't imagine you can continue your current mission now, can you?" She's right; you've just unwittingly kidnapped a person of great importance to the Britannians and murdered five soldiers. You'd be shot on the spot if you even approached the palace.

"Well? I'm waiting..."
1521.title: Pick up one of the guns and kill the soldiers.

choices: Xingke accepts, and leads you inside.
He says no; time for a slick manoevre!
15211.content:
Slowing down to think, you realise that there's only one place you can possibly go that's safe; the Chinese Federation Consulate, which was a short distance across town. With any luck, the Chinese would be willing to offer asylum. "Okay, I've got a plan; we'll head to the Chinese embassy! But... we'll need some wheels first, and I think I know just how to find them." "Hm," said C.C. in a vaguely amused voice. "Now, that's more like it."

Taking off down the nearest alleyway, you and C.C. manage to run a short distance before the distinctive sound of rolling Landspinners catches your attention. Hiding behind some trash cans, you watch as a Sutherland with crimson Purist Faction markings slowly trundles into the alley, scanning the area with its Factsphere camera. 'Scheiße, he must have spotted me...' Thinking quickly, you activate your Geass and disguise yourself as the Britannian Special Forces officer who stopped you earlier.

"Halt!" yells the man inside the metal warrior, shining a blinding spotlight in your face. "Identify yourself!" Stepping out from behind the cans, you stand up straight and say in your most snobbish faux-Britannian accent, "Myself? You're talking to a Captain of the Special Forces, soldier! Get out of that thing and show me some I.D.!" Suddenly less confident, the voice responds, "Uh, er, yes, Sir! Right away!" The canopy slides open, and a tall, blond-haired man in a blue dress uniform lowers himself down on the zipline. He stands ramrod-straight and salutes, introducing himself as, "Lord Kewell Soresi, at your service, sir!"

Kewell begins to pull out his I.D. papers, but you stop him, saying, "That's enough. I've received word from Headquarters that I am to... er, appropriate your Knightmare for the time being. Head back to base now; that's an order!" Looking genuinely confused for a moment, Soresi quickly recovers and salutes again. "Uh, yes, my Lord! As you command. Here are the keys; the activation code is THX-1138." Tossing the key to you, he walks off down the alley you came from, muttering something about, "How come those Special Forces guys get to have all the fun... ?"

As you drop your psychic veil, C.C. pops out from behind the garbage and congratulates you. "Bravo, Mr. [?]. You're catching on quite fast; my last contractor was already dead by this time." "Yeah, thanks," you reply, slipping back into German. "Don't just stand there, get in! We're not going to reach the Consulate standing around like damn statues!" As the two of you awkwardly cram yourselves into the cockpit, C.C. asks, "Do you even know how to drive this thing?" Your mind flashes back to your time as a member of the EU Army's German branch, piloting the Panzer-Hummel Knightmare Frame. Having been drafted at 17, you showed great skill and rose through the ranks quickly, becoming a member of the elite Death's Head Squadron. At 21, after completing your tour of duty, you decided to pursue your dreams and become a diplomat, which landed you where you are now.

"Of course, I do!" you answered smugly. Starting up the Sutherland, you make your way toward the consulate, steering around the ongoing battle in the ghetto. You briefly catch a glimpse of a mysterious, white-and-gold Knightmare of a type you've never seen before, but quickly dismiss it and keep driving. Arriving at the gates of the embassy, you pull over and fire a flare to get their attention. Within minutes, two of the CF's awkward-looking Gang-Lou Knightmares and a squad of armed men surround your Sutherland. Their leader, a well-built man with long, black hair and a sword at his belt spoke through a megaphone.

"I am Commander Li Xingke of the Chinese Federation Military," he yells. "Are you friend or foe, Britannian?" Opening the cockpit and placing your hands on your head, you respond in your admittedly shaky Chinese, "First, I'm not Britannian, I'm from the EU. Secondly, I've come seeking asylum from Britannia; are you willing to offer it?"
15211.title: Acquiring a ride.

choices: Lelouch joins you in the struggle against Britannia.
Xingke comes in and overhears your discussion.
152111.content:
Xingke huffed knowingly as you finished speaking. "Of course," he said. "Anyone wronged by those Britannian dogs is welcome here. Just drop any weapons you may have and come inside, <i>slowly</i>." Relieved, you and C.C. drop down the zipline of your stolen Sutherland, place your assault rifle on the ground, and slowly walk toward the Chinese commander, hands in the air.

As the two of you advanced toward the entrance, C.C. said quietly, "Well, it looks like you've done it again, [?]. I wonder how long your luck will last...?" Ignoring her, you face Xingke and his guards, who surround you on both sides. Walking through the large, ornate double-doors, Xingke turns to you. "You're actually the second refugee to show up here. A Britannian school boy who was injured came earlier. Exactly <i>what</i> is going on in the city right now?" Your stomach briefly churns as you recall the slaughter from earlier. "I'm not entirely sure," you begin. "Apparently, the Britannian forces are after this girl; they nearly killed me over her! I actually came for a diplomatic mission, but I doubt they care now; they're too busy slaughtering the Elevens in the ghetto."

Xingke curiously eyed your green-haired companion for a moment. "I... can't imagine why they would go to such lengths for just one person. Is she carrying any kind of sensitive data?" Before you could answer, C.C. glared at you, the message in her eyes quite clear: 'You <i>cannot</i> tell him about Geass!' Taking that into account, you merely shrug your shoulders in response to the commander's question.

The silence was suddenly interrupted by a comically high-pitched voice coming from down the hall. "Xingke?" said the voice. The voice belonged to a gaunt, pale man in fancy robes, flanked by heavily-armed bodyguards. "Are you bringing more foreign rabble into our consulate?" Xingke sighed exasperatedly, replying, "Minister Gao Hai, sir, these two are EU citizens who were attacked by Britannian forces. They came seeking political asylum." The High Eunuch merely turned up his nose at C.C. and yourself, saying, "Ugh, fine. Do what you wish with this... Eurotrash. Just don't overstep your boundaries..." With that, he and his entourage ascended the nearby stairs, leaving you alone.

"Anyway," began Xingke. "Whatever Britannia was after, we'll see to it that they answer for their actions. For now, you're free to stay here. Xianglin, lead these two to the guestrooms, will you?" An elegantly dressed young woman with elaborately-styled brown hair appeared, motioning for you to follow her upstairs. C.C. remained silent, apparently content to let you continue doing the talking. Your escort, Xianglin, suddenly spoke. "We're renovating most of the rooms at the moment, so you'll have to stay with the boy from earlier for now." You nodded silently, not particularly concerned as long as you could get a place to stay.

Once you reached the room, Xianglin handed you a key and motioned toward the door. "Here's where you will be staying. If you need anything, there is an intercom system. Just don't ask for anything ridiculous, and mind your 'roommate'". She then left, heading back downstairs. You knocked gingerly on the door, and a youthful voice on the other side answered in Britannian English. "It's open".

As you and C.C. entered, a boy sitting on the bed waved mirthlessly, greeting you with a deadpan, "Welcome. I assume you were caught up in the chaos outside, as well?" You examined him; he wore a black school uniform with stylish gold trim, and bloodied bandages were wrapped around his head, covering his silky black hair. He gazed back at you with piercing violet eyes and a vaguely bemused expression. "Yes," you answered. "I am [?], ambassador of the Euro Universe. And this is C.C., my... er, companion."

The boy extended a hand to shake. "Lelouch Lamperouge, student. A pleasure to meet another victim of Britannia's savagery." His voice dripped with suppressed rage; you couldn't help but wonder if perhaps he had some prior grievance with Britannia. Maybe it was just the power of your new Geass going to your head, but you suddenly felt an urge to help him. "Sounds like you're about as 'enthusiastic' about Britannia as I am," you began. "Maybe we can help you to actually do something about it." Lelouch stared at you for a moment, before an utterly sinister smile crept onto his face, actually scaring you slightly. "Well, then..."

Meanwhile, two strange figures surveyed the scene in the ghetto from the rooftops, watching as Britannian Knightmares, lead by a mysterious white unit, routed the rebel forces. One, a tall young man with white hair and bright blue eyes listened to his portable radio, hearing the panicked transmissions of the Japanese. "<i>Kallen! There's too many of them!</i>" said a frantic voice. "<i>Take Tamaki and the others and fall back-- aargh!</i>" The boy smiled for a moment before flipping a switch on the radio and speaking into it. "Agent Rai here. The enemy forces are in retreat; it looks like Asplund's new toy was a success, after all."

The other figure, a shorter boy with curly brownish hair, responded. "Yes, but we failed to capture C.C. We'll report our findings to the Emperor, but we shouldn't even consider returning to base until we've gotten a lead on her location. Agent Halliburton, out."
152111.title: Makings of an alliance?

choices: You use your phone contact your Superiors.
1521111.content:
You smile back at him, despite the small felling of unease caused by his smile. "Lelouch I have an offer for you." He keeps that damned smirk on his face as he Responds. "Oh and what is your offer Ambassador [?]?"

"I offer you the chance to come with me to the E.U, there you can provide us with intelligence about Britannia and we can provide you with the resources and training that you will need to fight against Britannia." Lelouch brings his hand up to his chin as he contemplates your offer. After a few seconds he speaks.

"I accept your offer if, you retrieve my little sister as well, i will not leave without her."

"Agreed." Well that will contemplate matters, but it will be worth it if you can bring a defector from Britannia, especially one that is from the nobility, which judging by his accent Lelouch is.

"I will get in contact with my superiors and see if then can arrange a way out of Area 11, for us and your sister."
1521111.title: Lelouch joins you in the struggle against Brita...

15211111.content:
It only takes a few minutes to establish contact with your superiors. You recognize the person answering your call, ambassador Jean Fremont.
"[?]! Where the hell are you, he screams, you are supposed to be negotiating with Prince Clovis!?"

"Sir, i was on my way to the summit, when three Sutherlands speed down the road, the Brittanien Scum started to gun down the the people on the street. I ran into an alley, where i encountered a girl, i tried to carry her out of there but then a squad of regular soldiers stopped me, the completely ignored my diplomatic immunity and tired to kill me, fortunately i manged to escape and i am now at the Chinese consulate and i require extraction for me and three others."

"They Attacked you?! Your'e an officially recognized ambassador, attacking you is an act of war!" Jean goes quiet for a moment before he starts talking again.

"I will try to get you extraction but with the Brittaniens ignoring your diplomatic immunity then it is unlikely that i will have to do it by via the official channels, i may have to use EuroForce (European Special Forces), but who are the others that need extraction?"

"The girl i found, her name is C.C, a Brittanien defector named Lelouch and his little sister, can you arrange this?"
15211111.title: You use your phone contact your Superiors.

1521112.content:
You hear the door creek behind, you, C.C. and Lelouch turn to the person that had entered the room, Xingke.

"Xingke, was there something you needed from any of use?" You ask him.

"Well, I could help but overhear your conversation you had with our guest. I understand that you are feeling the need to rebel against these
Britannian's, but such a feat is completly sucicidal."

"Why do you say so?" You ask.

"Well, Let's say our country has had very bad run-in's with Britannia in the past. If even someone spoke up agaisnt Britannia, they would immeditly strike us
where we are vunerable. They would go as far as assassinating the High Eunich's in our captiol of China, maybe even...assassinate our Empress." He said
with a worried tone in his voice while he shifted his eyes away from us.

"You sound like you have close relations with the Empress." Lelouch said.

"That does not matter, what matters is that it is not safe to venture to what destination you may have been assign to do by your goverment. They may be
already searching for you and your companion. I can have one of servents transfer you back to your homeland, along with her."

You then hear your cellphone go off in your pocket. You take it out and read the caller, it is one of your offical's at the E.U..
1521112.title: Xingke comes in and overhears your discussion.

15211121.content:
"Excuse me, I got to take these." You tell Xingke. You exit the room so that you can answer your call privatly. You answer the phone,
hearing the person at the other end sounding in deep panic.

"[Static], what happened out there? We recived reports about Britannian Soliders killing everyone during a gas leak in Area 11! We lost your signal a while ago!
We thought you were killed by them!"

"There seems to be more trouble than you think, Senator. I discovered a woman that needed medical assistance, but I was confronted by
five soliders. I showed them my Identifaction, but they had attempted to kill me off for odd reasons."

"My god, did you have nothing to protect yourself with?"

"I had to steal one of their weapons from their hands and neutrulize them."

He cussed quitely away from the phone on the phone and answered, "Do you know how much trouble our goverment is going to be in for that stunt you pulled off? Their going to have our heads on a god damn silver patter for this! You really made the shit hit the fan, [Static]!"

"You must understand, I had nothing to defend myself with! I couldn't just run away or stay there! They were already intended on killing me either way!
I had no choice, Senator!"

He sighed heavly and said, "Well, I suppose I can't blame you for this mess. But after what you did, there won't be anyway for us to march in their and
get you out of there. Where is your location?"

"I'm at one of the Chinese Asylum's somwhere out or inside of Area 11. I hiding out with the woman and a Britannian Student."

"Alright, at least your somewhere safe for now. Try to get out of that region if you can."

"Yes, sir."

I hung up phone and turned around to enter the guest room, only for the door to be blocked by...
15211121.title: Answer the phone.

15212.content:
You: well um Ms.C... I guess we should get out of the country first.

CC: sorry but I've got some previous engagements.

You: well okay then good luck with that.

As you begin to turn around you see lights down the alley way and you quickly try to get behind something and pull CC with you.



Where Do you Hide?
15212.title: Sponges

153.content:
Suddenly two of the three knightmares came up from behind. I tried to gather my thoughts of what happened but could not come up with anything. The knightmares raised their guns. I didn't know what to do. I didn't want to die here. "I don't want to die!" I yelled as I almost lost consciousness.

The knightmares lowered their guns. Some how I was saved. Suddenly an explosion and one fell to the ground as it's escape pod was activated. But that was shot down as well. The second was at least able to turn around before being shot and launched it's grappling cable, disabling it's opposite arm. I decided to run as soon as I gained my balance. As I turned around I saw the girl. I couldn't leave her behind could I?
153.title: Found

choices: Fight Britannia! The Revolution My Way!
Flee! I Don't want To Fight!
Fun! This Power is Mine So Why Not Have Fun With It!
1531.content:
With courage and speed I didn't know I had I swooped the girl into my arms and ran into the Shinjuku ghetto like the devil was on my heels. As I ran deeper into the war torn district I could hear gun fire and screams of men, women and children as the Britannian soldiers slaughtered them like animals. I knew that if any of them saw me they would assume I was Japanese and shoot me on sight. So I kept running for as long as I was able until I collapsed in an abandoned warehouse some distance away from the fighting.

As I sat on the floor gasping in some much needed air I couldn't help but ask myself "What am I even doing here? I don't even know this girl, why am I trying to save her? Why didn't I just leave her and run away from all this?..Running is all I really good at." I said rather depressingly. But it was true. All my life all I ever did was run. Run from the orphanage that took care of me, run form place to place, city to city, scrapping for food and money were I can(sometimes even stealing both) just drifting along the never ending road. I was a nobody. A wandering nobody.

"Is that really all you are?" a soft curious voice asked from my lap. I looked down to see the girl finally wake up from what was very deep slumber. Her bright golden eyes seemed to pierce my very soul as she then asked "What if you were more the what you think you are?" I try to ask what she was talking about but she seemed to read my mind and said "What if I can show you what you are really capable of?" she asked ominously. But before I can think of a answer the warehouse doors opened to reveal a group of Britannian soldiers that seem very pleased to find new lambs for the slaughter.

"Well well troops it looks like we found our little runaway." The leader of the troop said with twisted glee as he approached us drawing his gun. I felt my heart freeze at the sight what was very likely my death coming closer. I couldn't move, I could barely think as I heard the deafening sound of him pulling the trigger as blood slashed across my face as the girl was shot through the heart and fell on top of me.

But then in a split second I found myself in a strange white void with the girl standing in front of my with a rather cold stare."Is this how you want it to end? Do you really want to die here? An aimless drifter who was I the wrong place at the wrong time? Or do you want to live?" she asked with surprising power in her voice. A voice that forced me to answer with only the truth.

"I want to live."

"Then you will need power in order to make it through this." she said frankly "I can give you that power. Power most could only dream of having. The Power Of A King. But in exchange you will have to grant me my one wish. Do accept these terms?" I didn't know what was going on and at that moment I really didn't care. All I knew was that if this "Power" she was offering was my only way out of this mess then I only had one choice.

"Yes! I accept the terms of your contract!" I declared with certainty.

Now how can I describe what it was like to have my new power? Well it was once theorized that humans only consciously use a small portion of their brains. The human mind processes information in such incredible detail and yet we can only comprehend so much of it at once. Little do we realize that all of our senses are somewhat muted so we don't get sensory overload and have seizures. Now imagine seeing colors in new shades and hues you didn't know were possible, hearing sounds so acutely that you could literally hear a pin drop in a rock concert, smells become so distinct that you can close eyes and still tell someone the color of their hair, you can taste the air with your tongue like a snake and you could feel an ants foot steps from yards away. That was 1/3 of my new power.

Now I'm sure you have heard of people who have photographic memory right? Well what I had now was like that cranked up to 11. I could recall everything I ever saw, heard, smelled, tasted, touched with such accuracy it was like experiencing them all over again. I could even remember every dream I had throughout my life. That was the 2/3 of my power.

And I'm sure you have heard stories of people demonstrate feats of near superhuman level when put under extremely dangerous situations, like a mother lifting a car to save her trapped child. The human body is capable of more then we give it credit for. But the mind has limiters in place to keep us from destroying our bodies. Now imagine being able to turn off these limiters at will. That was the final part of my power. The power to unbound the built in limits of humanity and realize your true potential.

The Power Of Absolute Potential.

With this power I was capable of almost anything. I knew that with certainty. The possibilities flowed through my mind with perfect clarity. The only question was what do I do?
1531.title: Contract made! Potential unleashed!

1533.content:
Suddenly I felt pain as my nose started to bleed. I decided it was impossible to do anything for her. I fled into a near dilapidated building. Spying a laundry room I ran in just as the knghtmare brought most of the building down. I realized that I was trapped there was nowhere to go and that if I stayed where I was it would eventually find me with it's thermal optics. I looked through the window, hoping it wouldn't see me, but it quickly looked in my direction.

Suddenly shots, I cringed over, but found myself still alive. I looked out the window and saw a body lying on the floor. Unlucky guy. The knightmare turned it's attention to the girl. I decided to act. I opened the door and pushed out the laundry cart. Running behind it I grabbed the gun of the dead body as well as a fire extinguisher, spraying it all around me. The Knightmare spun around but obviously didn't understand what was going on. I hurled the fire extinguisher at it's already damaged mask and shot at it. The third one hit it and exploded in it's face. The mask crumbled to the ground and as a result the escape pod was forced to release.

I picked up the girl and ran but a soldier quickly caught up with me. "You pulled some crap with my knightmare over there!" he exclaimed. The he yelled "Turn around!" I quickly spun around and tried to kick him but he shot me in the leg. "AW!" After the pain subsided a little I remembered the previous two knightmares. They were comrades of his but he shot them anyway just for having mercy. I wished that some miracle would occur here as well. Suddenly I felt naucious again like I was being projected forward.

The soldier quickly lifted me up and started carrying me. I was stunned. Then soldiers started to surround us. "Bring them both back to base!" he shouted. "Yes, Colonel!" they responded.
1533.title: captured

15333.content:
They took the girl from me and...

I awoke tied to a chair shivering and soaked. The back of my head throbbed so much.

"I'll take it from here", the colonel said. The soldier clicked their heels, saluted and marched out. "How do you like the hospitality?" he asked.
"Better than the streets." I replied sarcastically. He approached me and said "Do you know who I am?" "You're the colonel..." "And your only lifeline. I am Colonel Inuji of the Britanian army. And better yet I am you."

"Could you repeat that one more time, I must still be a little wousy. It sounded like you said you were me."
"That's exactly what I said. When that babe met you she gave us this power. The power to transfer our minds to others."
"Wait, what?"
"When you were praying for a miracle you projected your thoughts into my mind. I then became you. Why else wouldn't I shoot you."
I paused for a moment unsure of this nutcase but he continued anyway.
"While you were unconscious I interrogated the green haired girl. She says this power is called thought projection. Apparently we're able to send our thoughts into a certain number of hosts. From there the only way to release it is to have that host transfer the power or for the host to die. Furthermore it seems that we can't be more than 200 meters away from each other at all times." he finished.

'So what does this mean?" I asked, wondering how I would react if I was in another body. Would I kill myself I thought.

"The higher-ups are on their way, I figured we should repay her gift. As for an escape I know all of this hosts bank accounts we should be able to run for weeks." he stated.
15333.title: Geass revealed

153331.content: You decide to run and leave the girl...Not to bright....They open fire and you die.
153331.title: BOOM HEADSHOT!!!

153332.content:
"Sound good to me," I replied. He quickly untied me. After learning the structure of the building and coming up with a plan I sat down. Colonel Inuji then called in the guards and began to leave. I then projected my thoughts into them and they became me. With our four man squad we pretended to transfer me from the interrogation room to a cell. As we headed towards the girl I projected my thoughts into 4 more soldiers. I realized it was becoming hard for me to control so many. My nose was bleeding profusely. I tried to take one more but suddenly he started shouting traitors and shot 3 of the 6 of us. Colonel Inuji quickly disposed of him. But not before the sirens went off. Soldiers were gaining on us from behind and we were still far away from our goal. The 2 remaining soldiers defended our backs as we tried to hide.

We ran into a room, turned off the lights for the camera and hid. I suddenly felt like I was about to have a concussion. 2 soldiers walked into the room. I used my power on them. Luckily they didn't betray me. Suddenly I felt another spasm and fell to the ground I was still conscious but I couldn't move. The 2 soldiers left the room and reported that we weren't there. Colonel Inuji pulled me up through the vent and carried us into another empty room. After I was able to stand we prepared to head out. Then there was a report over the loudspeaker "the higher-ups are here all soldiers report to b1 to protect there safe arrival from the traitors."

After a minute we charged through the empty halls to the entrance we had agreed on. We traveled down the stairs. Boom an explosion came just as we reached the bottom of the stairs, taking out all the guards my nose began to bleed and my skull was hemmoraging. We reached the inside but the girl was already gone. Soldiers were lying dead as a truck drove off recklessly into the distance. But there were still soldiers there.

I took control of as many as I could. But couldn't reamina conscious anymore.

I awoke in a garbage dump.
153332.title: Save the girl!

info.brief_description: You obtain a Geass. Use it's power to rebel, conquer, or just entertain yourself!
info.description:
Once upon a mid-day stroll, you happen upon a girl by the name of C.C. After a surprising kiss, you find yourself bound into a contract that gives you an extrordinary power, Geass, a power that lies dormant within the eye and gives the ability to somehow affect the mind. How will you use this newfound ability? Will you follow in the footsteps of the anime, and try to destroy Britannia? Will you climb to the top of the empire? Will you abuse your abilities for self pleasure? It's up to you!


==========WARNING==========

This Interactive may very well include spoilers for the end of Code Geass, and Code Geass R2, the second season currently airing in Japan. If you do not wish to risk being spoiled, turn back now.


Rules
1. For the most part, anything goes. Just keep it withing reason.
2. Don't spoil things for no reason. If the story can go without mention of the spoiler, do it.
3. It takes place during 2010 A.B. a.k.a. Code Geass Universe. Keep in mind, this version of Earth is different from the reality.
4. You play a unique character, by you can use Geass powers from the show.
5. Geass powers follow the anime's guidelines. All Geass powers have faults and weaknesses, and all Geass powers are MIND BASED. (No Superspeed, no Eye Lasers, exc.)
info.pretty_title: Code Geass: You are the Rebellion
